title: Satricum
description: An ancient settlement on the right bank of the river Astura, Satricum has a mixed heritage of Latins and Volscians. In 499 BC Satricum was a member of the Latin League, but was under Volscian control in 488 BC. The site is noted for its sanctuary of Mater Matuta.

properties.description: A sanctuary to Mater Matuta in use between the seventh and fifth centuries BC
properties.title: Temple of Mater Matuta

properties.description: A necropolis located along a road that once led to the Mater Matuta sanctuary composed of approximately 50 tombs.
properties.title: Post-Archaic necropolis
